articles.author: Maayan Lubell, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: What will come next remains unclear in the absence of a comprehensive agreement on the postwar future of Gaza, and although the stated aim of the ceasefire is to end the war entirely, it could easily unravel.
articles.title: Gaza ceasefire and hostage release set to begin

articles.author: Hyunsu Yim, Jack Kim
articles.description: South Korea's impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol refused on Monday to be questioned by investigators under a probe into whether he committed insurrection, as dozens of his supporters faced arrest over a violent rampage on a court building.
articles.title: South Korea's Yoon shuns questioning as security tightened after court rampage

articles.author: Joe Cash, Josh Arslan, Ryan Woo
articles.description: Chinese officials and ordinary people are hopeful but on edge as Donald Trump returns to the White House, eager to avoid a repeat of the bruising trade war that drove a wedge between the economic superpowers during his first term.
articles.title: China both hopeful and on edge as Trump returns to White House

articles.author: Sarah Marsh
articles.description: A Russian disinformation campaign is seeking to boost the far-right Alternative for Germany (AfD), undermine mainstream German parties and sow worries about the economy ahead of the country's Feb. 23 election, a think-tank has found.
articles.title: Russian disinformation targets German election campaign, says think-tank

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia has opened an investigation after video footage was published on social media showing what appear to be a military policeman savagely beating contract soldiers bound for Ukraine with a baton and using stun guns against them.
articles.title: Russia opens investigation after video of military police beating soldiers is released online

articles.author: Joseph Ax
articles.description: Donald Trump will be sworn in today, ushering in another turbulent four-year term with promises to push the limits of executive power, deport millions of immigrants, secure retribution against his political enemies and transform the role of the US on the world stage.
articles.title: Triumphant Trump returns to White House, launching new era of upheaval

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump will call for a "revolution of common sense" during his inaugural address, the Wall Street Journal said on Monday citing excerpts of his prepared remarks.
articles.title: Trump to call for 'revolution of common sense' in inaugural address, WSJ reports

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Philippine law enforcers have arrested a Chinese national on suspicion of espionage, recovering in his possession equipment authorities believe could be used for spying on military facilities.
articles.title: Philippines arrests Chinese national on suspicion of espionage

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Myanmar military and the Myanmar National Democratic Alliance Army (MNDAA) signed a formal agreement for a ceasefire that began on Saturday, China's foreign ministry said, halting fighting near the border of both countries.
articles.title: Myanmar military, minority armed group agree ceasefire, China says

articles.author: Ethan Wang, Yukun Zhang, Ryan Woo
articles.description: The frugal trend that began in China during the economic disruption of the pandemic and deepened amid the crisis in the property market is intensifying as Gen Z shuns government calls to spend, spend, spend and doubles down on saving.
articles.title: China's frugal young adults accelerate saving, raising economic risks
